review_blob: Maybe Im not worthy this beer was perfectly clear excellent aroma but just too oily this goes and oily green grassy hops way too over-the-top.
Excellent aroma perfectly clear excellent carbonation great white head. It had a slight astringentcy, extremely dry, still a very good beer

This beer is hit and miss the particular batch I had was very stout in characteristic. Overall decent beer Ive had better from this plac and Ive had worse. This one was generally a good bet for a thick rich stout type of beer.
Very solid beer very well-balanced nice hop aroma very citrusy piney grassy nice dry finish excellent carbonation great bear

Nice malty beer nice aroma of malts, a deep red Garnet color excellent on carbonation very well balanced with the Hops in maltiness. I like caramelization slight sweetness that added to the body and over at flavor great beer

Amber Color very low carbonation rubber tire aroma bicycle tire flavor various astringent character, not bad body just the hop usage seems off. May be old hops. Will retry soon just to see if off batch.
beer_name: Mother Earth Pin Up Pale Ale

review_blob: Amber color and has beet sugar aroma. Out of balance from sweetness and fruity wanna be tartness. Phenolic character. Just not a real fan.
beer_name: Mother Earth Los Cuatros Amigos Agave Saison

review_blob: Excellent brew little head extremely good aroma smells like the inside of a Zinfandel barrel. Slight tobacco slight sourness somewhat fruity very well-balanced very complex multi malt/funky brew very enjoyable
On tap was pretty clear grassy hoppy citrus aroma nice bitter on the forefront nice good grassy bitter finish very good beer. Would definitely have again at the brewery.
Slight metallic aroma. Very lean, not to much going on. Bottle low to medium carbonation. To be expected for a macro brewery.

Nutty aroma, nice sense of caramelzation. A little banana but kinda liked it. Pretty good medium carbonation. Extremely drinkable. Nothing really outstanding but good beer none the less. Would drink again.

" Ive been ionized, but I am OK" Quote from Buckaroo Banzai, as I just had something 8 dimensional. Very slight cloudiness, medium carbonation, wonderful sour dough aroma with a slight phenolic hefe yeast nose. First, initial flavor, bracingly sour. Yeast breadlines comes through the sourness. Some what of a pineapple sour brightness. In the back it is earthy pencil lead and barnwood. I could almost taste my grandmothers basement. The olfactory sences from the flavor permeating through make this a true enjoyable experience. 750 ml.
Nice example of an American Pale, nice crisp hop flavor, great grain balance really nice finish.
beer_name: Noble Ale Works Breakaway Pale Ale

review_blob: Citrus grapefruit aroma, bitter grassy hop flavor. Slight haze. Nice dry finish. Good example of IPA
beer_name: Noble Ale Works Big Whig IPA

review_blob: Not too shabby, dry fairly drinkable, a little astringent. Yeasty cheese character. Decent phenolics. Overall ok
beer_name: Jester King Noble King Hoppy Farmhouse Ale (Batch 1-10)

review_blob: Wonderful aroma super duper clear. Very hoppy oily and cloying. Not to my liking. Not very drinkable. I have had many DIPAs many drinkable. This one is just too oily and viscous.

Twelve ounce bottle....twelve bucks...WFS....WTF....just expensive restaraunt not BPs fault. Ive seen it in stores for good price. Great floral aroma. Great citrus sharp bitter hoppy flavor. Excellent IPA.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Bottle from a friend....flat. May be stored badly or off cork??? Ruined the palate, and there was no aroma due to that fact. Taste really good. I am sure if I got a proper bottle or if it was stored properly it would be a 4.5+ hope I get another chance to retry and re rate

Love the aroma on this. Oh BTW a 750 champagne style bottle. Back to aroma. Somewhat like asking through an orchard after a wet musty rain. Earthy yeast with a sharp sourness. Enjoyable drinking brew.

Extremely bready nose very yeasty, not too bad though. The slight esters slowly came through the thick white head. Oh BTW it was on tap. Great sour character with slight sharp cheddar character. Id have again.
22oz from Whole Foods , I think Whole foods pours brown tan head, aroma of almond and pecans. Light body but good beer and good carbonation.
750ml bottle. Caramel cocoa aroma. Similar taste. Seems a little sweet but still very enjoyable beer.
Ok had to rate for shirts and giggles. On tap at an all inclusive place in cabo. Pretty metallic insipid mullah. Hell it was free. Corona is better
Dark red low carbonation. Great earthy leather flavor with a well balanced tartness. Sour aged hops added to dimension. Great example!

At GABF citrus, Citra hops???? Great character of differences of hops. Pretty bitter but expected for a DIPA but extremely drinkable medium body. Copper clear color. Would love to try it in a snifter type of glass to enjoy the hops more.
Meh, corn grain aroma, very clear yellow light real lite fizzy yellow . Same grain flavor and corn cooked corn flavor. It is what it is.
Meh, very lean, citric acid type cherry aroma, may be a coors with hi c mixed in.

750 ml bottle, reddish color, champagne like carbonation, strong cherry nose. Excellent flavor not too overpowering like some cherry lambics. Cheery and lacto sourness compliment each other. Just a little tinge of medicinal character. Great brew
Ehhh can, not horrible, but nothing great. Brown simple malt, some what tangie, pecans help. Better than the big can dudes.

Poured from a 22iz bottle at 2013 GABF. Wonderful citrus hop biscuit aroma. Wish I had a real glass not the one ounce pour. Mouthfeel is really rich malty treat, with a bitter hop crisp finish. So many different dimensions to thus brew. I did taste some noticeable heat, yet I thought it was a plus, with the other characteristics of this brew.

Had at GABF 2013 and many times before. Litmus test for the double IPA. Big resinous citrus pine hops. Clear great carbonation t bring out hop profiles. I really cant say what others have not already said.

Had at GABF 2013. Unreal great non IPA but never the less it is an IPA in its purest sense. Unlike most IPAs that I shy away from this has a multy dimension of hops from aroma to mouthfeel to finish. Balanced IPA sounds strange but this s not you typical IPA that folks shove tons of Citra at you. Great great great!
beer_name: Monkey Paw Bonobos IPA/SD Pale Ale

review_blob: Had at 2013 GABF...stupendous beer I could just chew the oak. The aroma is fantastic. The rich caramel and oak balance is heavenly. And I had this all in a stupid one ounce GABF glass. I am heading to Corona to try and get this in a real glass. A bucket list brew for sure.
Pale straw haze, off white head, very light carbonation. Yeasty spicy aroma almost hefe like, slight sour ness in flavor, would have liked a smidge more. Very good brew none the less.
Huge big imperial giant brew. Scottish wee heavy esc. Caramel rich slight burnt roast, some anis, and vinious. Herbal hops very subdued. Carbonation fitted the immense style. Not for faint of heart.
beer_name: The Bruery Black Tuesday Imperial Stout

review_blob: Extremely sour fruity aroma, first apple then lambic fruity sourness. Excellent carbonation even in the small stupid gabf glass. Perfect blende of the fruits and the sourness, I felt like I was in the cranberry bogs. I would have stayed at the booth all night but the line would have rioted.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Another swing and a hit! Had at GABF 2013. Extreme cherry aroma. Excellent balance of oak and rich ale characteristics. Some barnyard pencil lead and wet hay. Cherries dance through your palate and the other notes continue to supports the prominent flavors. Fantastic.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: A fascinating brew. Had at 2013GABF. Very sour tart and slight salt flavor, along with oak character. What was great is it did not ave the typical medicinal manufactured character. This was a true aged funk, bacteria melody! Body and mouthfeel and efferveciant carbonation was exquisite.

Cherry aroma some rope and barnyard yeasty,bacteria funk, very balanced. Sharp initial sour acid on the palate, some NyQuil coughs drop but all well balanced and enjoyable. Great carbonation...overall a great enjoyable cherry lambic....excellent.

Cherry fruity aroma. Similar to a life-saver candy crushed up. Extreme bubbly carbonation, very thin on mouthfeel. Doesnt seem to have the aged sour funk for a Kriek. However not offensive. Just lacks some immersion.
